description: The Department of National Defence has a requirement for the items detailed below.  This bid is to provide delivery to CFB Halifax, Nova Scotia and CFB Esquimalt, British Columbia. Various specifics:
full_summary:
=================================
**Tender Announcement**
=================================
**Solicitation Number**: W8482-242342/A
**Publication Date**: 2023-11-17
**Tender Closing Date**: 2023-12-19T14:00:00

**Synopsis**
------------

The Department of National Defence invites bidders to submit proposals for the procurement of Spares Kits, Shroud S, for the CFB Halifax, Nova Scotia and CFB Esquimalt, British Columbia. The requirement is for 20 units of the SK160 part number, NCAGE K1175, from MOBREY LTD. Bidders proposing equivalent or substitute products must indicate the brand name, model, and/or part number, and NCAGE.

**Tender Details**
----------------

* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
* **Selection Criteria**: Lowest Price (Canadian Dollars)
* **Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Regions of Opportunity**: World
* **Regions of Delivery**: Nova Scotia, British Columbia

**Contracting Entity**
-------------------

The Department of National Defence, located at 101 Colonel By Drive, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0K2, Canada.

**Contact Information**
-------------------

* Anthony Lemoine-Hoefsmit (Contracting Officer)
* Phone: (819) 939-3725
* Email: Anthony.Lemoine-Hoefsmit@forces.gc.ca

**Tender Documents**
-------------------

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. A copy of the tender documents is available for download from the Canadabuys website.

**Notice URL**: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender\_notice/25064/w8482-242342---english-rfp-clauses\_0.pdf

**French Language Documents**: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender\_notice/25064/w8482-242342---french-rfp-clauses.pdf

**Submission Requirements**
-------------------------

Bidders must submit prices in Canadian dollars. Bids submitted in foreign currency will be rejected. The requirement is subject to a preference for Canadian goods and/or services. The Crown retains the rights to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. submissions should be made through the official procurement platform.

Note: I removed unnecessary fields, formatted in markdown format as requested, and revised to improve clarity and
